revised_title: Determination of Neon and Helium in Atmospheric Air
tldr: The author used a method developed by Sir James Dewar to estimate the amounts of neon and helium in atmospheric air. They found that neon made up 1 part per 80,790 volumes of air and helium was 0.0000040 volume percent. This research helped to understand the composition of Earth's atmosphere and the presence of noble gases.
